title: News regarding Velocity Motors
story_body:
Velocity Motors Names New VP of Fleet Operations

Velocity Motors (VELO) announced today the appointment of Marcus Chen as Vice President of Fleet Operations, effective immediately. Chen, who previously served as Senior Director of Commercial Sales at the company, will oversee VELO's growing fleet management division.

"Marcus brings deep knowledge of our commercial customers' needs to this role," said VELO CEO Patricia Thornton in a statement. "His experience will be valuable as we continue to expand our fleet services."

Chen joined Velocity Motors in 2019 and has held various positions within the company's sales organization. He replaces Jennifer Rodriguez, who left the company in September to pursue other opportunities.

In other company news, VELO will participate in the upcoming Global Automotive Summit in Detroit next month. The company plans to showcase its latest electric delivery van prototype at the three-day conference, which runs from November 15-17.

"We're looking forward to engaging with industry partners and sharing insights on the future of commercial electrification," said Chief Technology Officer David Park, who will lead VELO's delegation at the event.

Additionally, Velocity Motors launched a new marketing campaign this week titled "Drive Forward," featuring testimonials from fleet customers across various industries. The multi-channel campaign will run through the end of the year across digital platforms and trade publications.

The company also announced a new recycling initiative at its manufacturing facilities aimed at reducing waste by 15 percent over the next two years. The program focuses on improved sorting of production materials and partnerships with local recycling facilities.

"Environmental responsibility is part of our commitment to sustainable transportation," said Sarah Mitchell, VELO's Director of Sustainability. "This initiative represents one of several steps we're taking to minimize our operational footprint."

Velocity Motors reported third-quarter earnings last month, with revenue of $2.3 billion, up 8 percent year-over-year. The company maintains its full-year guidance and expects to deliver between 95,000 and 100,000 vehicles in 2024.

Shares of VELO closed at $34.67 yesterday, up 0.3 percent. The stock has gained 12 percent year-to-date.
